item.title: Radon Transformation
item.description: Definition Let’s assume that a function $f :D \to \mathbb{R}$ is defined on some 2D domain $D\subset \mathbb{R}^{2}$. The Radon transform $\mathcal{R}f$ of $f$ is defined as follows, for $s \in \mathbb{R}$, $\boldsymbol{\theta} = (\cos \theta, \sin \theta) \in S^{1}$, $$ \begin{align*} \mathcal{R} f(s, \boldsymbol{\theta}):=&\ \int \limits_{t=-\infty}^{\infty} f ( s \boldsymbol{\theta} + t \boldsymbol{\theta}^{\perp} )dt \\ =&\ \int \limits_{t=-\infty} ^{\infty} f \left( s\cos\theta-t\sin\theta, s\sin\theta + t\cos\theta \right)dt \end{align*} $$ Explanation
